channel.title: Humour on Sheena Cook
channel.description: Recent content in Humour on Sheena Cook

item.title: Entrapment
item.description: Trapped in a gilet Looking like a Hooray I borrowed it to keep warm Now my face is red it’s hotter than my bed The zip is dodgy My frame looks podgy Trapped in a gilet Hardly a crisis siutation On release a tiny celebration.

item.title: Dry January
item.description: Why try? Why try to be dry? What might occur? A social slur Whining for wine A vodkaless void All things ifzzy Make you dizzy Don’t really care for alcopops Always taste of sugary slops Avoid ruthless piratical rum< No making merry with sherry Life feels queer Without beer Whistfully wishing for whisky Gin a major sin Acting with glee Faced with herbal tea Fortified by water Filling us with cheer The challneg of staying clear Of any percentage proof Might make us appear Sensible and aloof Please don’t judge When we try To get through January dry

item.title: Lady Macbeth/The Lady’s Flush
item.description: Forsooth, perhaps, or strewth. A glimmer of truth. Were the words of a witch? Trigger for a power crazed bitch. All that nocturnal wandering. Suggested she was pondering. Her and the thane’s wrongdoing. A miasma of guilt brewing. Rambling about the damned spot. Menopausal, sweaty and hot. The misguided onus on ambition. Resulting in insomnia and contrition. And there be the truth. Lady Macbeth just long in the tooth.

item.title: Goths in pedalloes
item.description: Here goes Toward the pedalloes Clothes black as night An unexpected sight Wander through the park Collectively dark Under heavy fringes Adolescent twinges Of handsome faces Are definite traces Kohl rimmed eyes Loosened parental ties Payment taken Reserve shaken Languildy pedalling Havey soled treddling Relax a while Share a smile Tending to be introspective Now in a social collective Perspectives are broader Gathered atop the water
